Justia Lawyer Directory Now Displays Video Chat & Office Availability

We are excited to announce that the Justia Lawyer Directory now displays video chat availability and more detailed office information on lawyer profiles. To help individuals easily find lawyers who offer video chat, they may now use the "Offers Video Chat" filter on their searches. Also, for each office listed on your profile, you may update the hours of availability, opening & closing times per day, whether you offer 24-hour support, and any special notices you would like to include, such as that you are conducting consultations by video chat due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Be found when consumers use the video chat search filter, and make it easy for them to contact you by listing your office hours!

Update Your Availability & Office Hours Now

Tech News

Internet Providers Won’t Cut Off Users Over Unpaid Bills for 60 Days

Major telecom providers including AT&T and Comcast have promised not to disconnect small business or residential customers unable to pay for services due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

How China Built Facial Recognition for People Wearing Masks

A facial recognition company has developed the ability to identify people wearing masks with up to 95 percent accuracy, with demand for its services growing as coronavirus spreads.

The Internet is Drowning in COVD-19-Related Malware and Phishing Scams

The coronavirus pandemic has unleashed a flood of scam emails and websites promoting malware and disinformation to millions under the guise of providing virus-related updates.

After Dregulatory Blitz, FCC Scrambles to Prevent ISP Abuse During Pandemic

Following FCC actions to repeal net neutrality and deregulate the broadband industry, the Commission has not persuaded ISP providers to lift data caps during the COVID-19 outbreak.

SEO News

13 Ways Businesses Can Use SEO & Marketing to Combat Coronavirus Impact

Marketing projects you can tackle during this time include updating your GMB listings, reviewing content assets, and publicizing your use of video chat and remote work options.

Early Look: Google Ads Customer Value Reporting and Conversion Value Rules

Two new test features in Google Ads would allow users to sort their highest value customers by demographic, and customize conversion values to reflect their business objectives.

5 Completely Sane Reasons Why You Shouldn’t Stop SEO Efforts During COVID-19

Businesses that continue to invest in search marketing during the coronavirus outbreak can benefit from increased cash flow and measurable SEO initiatives, among other gains.

Keeping Your GMB Listing Accurate & Updated During COVID-19 Pandemic

Utilizing GMB features that allow you to update your hours, contact information, description, and more can help your clients continue to reach you during the coronavirus crisis.

Did You Know?

Google Temporarily Disables Reviews and Q&A

Due to COVID-19, Google announced that they are temporarily disabling reviews and Q&A functionality on all Google listings. During this time, users will not be able to leave new reviews, business owners won't be able to reply to reviews and users will be temporarily unable to ask or answer questions via Google Q&A. Google is making this change in order to protect against misinformation in times like this.

Google’s prioritization of critical services will also extend to reviewing business information edits, so if your business does not provide a critical, health-related service, it may be some time before you see any edits go live on your GMB listing.

Social Media News

YouTube Says More Videos Will Be Removed Than Usual for the Time Being

Reduced office staffing during the COVID-19 pandemic means that YouTube will rely more on automated systems to review content, likely resulting in more videos being taken down.

Facebook and Twitter Suspend Russian Trolls Trying to Stoke US Race Tensions

Dozens of accounts based in African countries were disabled after discoveries that their owners were acting on behalf of Russian individuals to inflame racial tensions in the US.

LinkedIn Introduces Conversation Ads: A New Message-Based Ad Format

The professional networking platform’s new ad option is designed to help businesses offer more personalized content to customers in order to generate higher quality engagement.

Slack Unveils Its Biggest Redesign Yet

Changes to the workplace messaging app’s design include improved customization in the sidebar, a top navigation bar, and other features intended to simplify user experience.

Legal Industry News

Coronavirus Could Be Tipping Point for Tech Competence in Law

The COVID-19 pandemic and resulting social distancing policies will likely require lawyers and law firms to embrace remote and virtual practice technology to a much greater degree.

Free Products and Resources for Legal Professionals During Coronavirus Crisis

Lawyers and law firms can consult this frequently updated list of free resources, products, and support to access virtual and other tech practice solutions during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Ethics and Civil Procedure Are Most Important Knowledge Areas for New Lawyers, Survey Says

According to a survey of almost 15,000 practicing attorneys, contracts, the rules of evidence, and legal research are also among the most critical subjects for new lawyers to understand.

US News Releases Its 2021 Law School Rankings

Yale, Stanford, and Harvard have topped the list of US News & World Report’s law school rankings for the third year in a row, while other top-10 schools changed positions slightly.

Justia Lawyer Rating and Reviews

Featured Lawyer

Brandon Davis

NORTHFIELD, IL

Justia Lawyer Rating and Reviews is a system designed for lawyers to provide valuable insight from peers and colleagues personally familiar with the lawyer’s work.

Lawyers who have received reviews will have a badge on their profile showing their Justia Lawyer Rating, a numerical representation of the reviews they have received. Our research shows that the Rating Badge is the most used search filter in the Justia Lawyer Directory.

Don’t miss out on your chance to showcase your Justia Lawyer Rating badge on your websites, blogs, and other properties!

Human Factors Engineering Expert Witness Excluded from Testifying in Product Liability Case

Plaintiff's Human Factors Engineering Expert Witness was not allowed to testify on whether there was a duty to examine the safety of a gas can before selling it.

Coronavirus: Expert Witness Testimony by Video Conferencing?

With the onset of the Coronavirus, Expert Witnesses might be forced to present their testimony through video conferencing rather than in public.
